results.title: Facebook and Twitter Have a Message for Lawmakers: We’re Trying
results.abstract: In prepared testimony ahead of congressional hearings on Wednesday, Facebook and Twitter displayed a conciliatory approach over issues such as disinformation and manipulation.
results.byline: By CECILIA KANG and SHEERA FRENKEL

multimedia.caption: Sheryl Sandberg, Facebook’s chief operating officer.
Sheryl Sandberg, Facebook’s chief operating officer.

results.title: Amazon Hits $1,000,000,000,000 in Value, Following Apple
results.abstract: Apple became the first public company to be worth $1 trillion. Amazon hit the same milestone a month later, but the reasons for the e-commerce titan’s rise are more complicated.

multimedia.caption: Amazon’s founder and chief executive, Jeff Bezos, is richer, by far, than anyone in the modern world.
Amazon’s founder and chief executive, Jeff Bezos, is richer, by far, than anyone in the modern world.

results.title: Alex Jones Said Bans Would Strengthen Him. He Was Wrong.
results.abstract: Bans by Facebook and YouTube drastically reduced the reach of Infowars, Mr. Jones’s right-wing conspiracy site, a review of its traffic shows.

multimedia.caption: Alex Jones speaking near the Republican National Convention in 2016. In the weeks after Facebook and YouTube barred him last month, the audience for his Infowars website and videos fell nearly by half, according to a New York Times analysis.
multimedia.copyright: Hilary Swift for The New York Times
